result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon T Upham

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devon T Upham appeared by video.  Attorney Kathleen A Kruse appeared by video for Devon T Upham.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Devon T Upham in court with attorney Kathleen A Kruse.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devon T Upham appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with ELS (DOB 5/23/1993).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the surety.

Defendant Devon T Upham in court with attorney Kathleen A Kruse.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.   Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 065004,
Payable Number: 1019149,
Receipt Number: 22RP028044,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/26/22 @ 2p
